page.title: 17SHILDON WAGON WORKS
page.content: Shildon Wagon Works was in business for over 150 years,completing 800 repairs each week.It had a great reputation until 1983 when British Rail decided to close it down. My Dad was one of the 2000 workforce to be made redundant.The works and track were demolished and new industry was attracted to the area with the aid of grants,help from BR and new factory units. The town still has one of the highest levels of unemployment in the country.Some of my father's friends took the opportunity to transfer to other BR workshops in other parts of the country, but our family, along with hundreds of others, has commitments in the area and it was impossible for us to uproot the whole of our family and move to another part of the country.My father is still unemployed.
